pull.title: Batch construct batches
pull.body:
Reuse the serialization buffers used for constructing the LevelDB write batch. This avoids 2 allocations per utxo write.

I have not benchmarked this exact change, but in another branch I'm working on it results in a 12% speedup for the flush.

events.message:
Batch construct batches

Reuse the serialization buffers used for constructing the LevelDB
write batch. This avoids 2 allocations per utxo write.

events.body: ACK.  (I tested this on the above mentioned other branch.)

issue.title: Add data() method to CDataStream (and use it)
issue.body:
Analogous to c++11 vector data().

Came up in #9346. Also removes a silly ancient MSVC conditional.

I've also tried to replace some uses, but I'm not 100% sure that I caught all the uses of `&CDataStream[0]`. As a casual `git grep '&[a-zA-Z0-9_]\+\[0\]'` shows the pattern is still very common for bare vectors. These uses too should be replaced with `data()` at some point but not here.

issue.title: Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#10195
issue.body:
Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#10195 (bitcoin/bitcoin@1088b02f0ccd7358d2b7076bb9e122d59d502d02)

Work tree so far (read bottom-up)

- merge #4980 
- merge #4979 
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@e484652fc
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9260 or patch to main.cpp
    - 0001-Introduce-CHashVerifier-to-hash-read-data.patch
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@f54580e7e
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9260 or patch to main.cpp
    - 0001-error-in-disconnect-for-disk-corruption-not-inconsis.patch
      - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@b50cd7a67e from bitcoin/bitcoin#9107
        - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@07df40babb for coins_tests.cpp from bitcoin/bitcoin#9308
           - removed coinbase-specific sections
        - bitcoin/bitcoin@8504867b14: IGNORED, part of bitcoin/bitcoin#7056 that is not relevant to us
        - requires bitcoin/bitcoin@14470f9aa6 from bitcoin/bitcoin#6932: MERGED already in 2018
        - bitcoin/bitcoin#6931: IGNORED
          - No need for bitcoin/bitcoin@06d81ad516 but noted that we can 
            remove the "tried to overwrite transaction" check.
          - bitcoin/bitcoin@33c90cf1972 IGNORED
        - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@072e2f86444 from bitcoin/bitcoin#5967 
          - required zcash-specific changes
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@e66dbde6d14
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9346 
    - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@ed58969

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

comments.body: CDataStream should really get a `.data()`. Not necessarily here though :)
Agree, but let's do that separately (#9353?).
